summary: Somewhat of a slow day today. Didn't get too many stuff done, but hey it happens.

I redesigned iron processing to use the crusher. The new setup is much more efficient—5 iron ore per plate instead of 8—but the power requirements and size of the crusher mean I can only keep a few running. The majority of smelting is still done by direct insertion for now.

While analyzing steel production, I noticed the real bottleneck is limestone, which itself is limited by water purification. To address this, I redesigned the water purification setup, increasing capacity fourfold to support higher steel output.

I also researched glasswork, which is needed for advanced production. However, it requires quartz, and I currently don’t have access to any chunks containing quartz. To prepare, I researched one additional chunk, though it still isn’t enough to reach quartz deposits. Future expansion will need to focus on locating and claiming quartz-rich chunks.
